metadata.Title: CVE-2018-6155 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - high
metadata.Description:
Incorrect handling of frames in the VP8 parser in Google Chrome prior to68.0.3440.75 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heapcorruption via a crafted video file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-6155` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 68.0.3440.75-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 68.0.3440.75-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 68.0.3440.75-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 68.0.3440.75-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 68.0.3440.75-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '68.0.3440.75-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
oxide-qt: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
